boardgame.name: To the Last Breath
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Final Adventure for Heroes of Rokugan (Champions of the Sapphire Throne)

This scenario is primarily a Battle Interactive in which multiple tables will play through the final struggle against Akodo Gintaku. Consequently, timing will be important – GMs will need to be cognizant of time and make sure they keep track of it. The overall sequence of the event will proceed as follows:
boardgame.rpgseries: Heroes of Rokugan: Champions of the Sapphire Throne
boardgame.rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (3rd Edition)

boardgame.name: Mausbarian
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Mausbarian is a small world for the Mausritter Role-Playing Game, inspired by Robert E. Howard's Age of Hyborea. It contains background information and tables for Mausborea - an ancient continent where barbarians, pirates, witches and sorcerers battle for survival and domination.

In addition to lore, this zine currently contains two tables – Houses of Worship and Upbringings - that can replace or supplement the Birthsign and Backgrounds tables of Mausritter’s character creation process. A future version of this zine will include more spells and items, as well as a hexcrawl adventure based in the no-mouse land of Medvediya.

boardgame.name: Metal Spider Webs
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Another fiendish trap for your MÖRK BORG game.

boardgame.name: d40 Curer's Medical Supplies
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The dying world is a dangerous place. Healing wounds and treating infections is crucial to living just a little longer.

boardgame.name: Pope Lick Monster
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Trolls in MÖRK BORG are too big to live under bridges, opening a perfect habitat for the Pope Lick Monster.

boardgame.name: The Final Light-Year: The Cratos Sector
boardgame.description:
April 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new sector map, new overlord, minion and commander ships and a new event.


Released in the April 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

ÐÐ¾Ð½Ð¾Ð¿Ð¾Ð»Ð¸Ñ ÐÐ¾Ð»Ð³Ð¾Ð³ÑÐ°Ð´, or Monopoly: Volgograd is a revisited version of the classic game of Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the city of Volgograd in Russia.

Buy local businesses and win by bankrupting the other players.

boardgame.name: Indiepocalypse #1 "Made in MA"
boardgame.description:
Hello and welcome to Indiepocalypse!

In its simplest terms, Indiepocalypse is just a bundle of games (common thing) packaged with a zine (also common thing) about the aforementioned games and comics, reviews and more!

Each month will feature games by 10 different developers. Each issue I hope to bring together games that explore the breadth of what our art form has to offer.

Also, and this part is very important to me and should truly be taken as given, each contributor is paid and developers are paid royalties on all future sales.

boardgame.name: Usurper: Claim to Power
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Usurper, a fantasy role playing game of adventure and storytelling.

Usurper is a fantasy adventure game of quick, light hearted adventure. Using a simple table to resolve actions on, the game allows for various degrees of success, random events and unexpected outcomes without any complicated math.

Characters are described in plain English terms rather than lists of numbers and modifiers and can be created to taste in a matter of minutes with a notepad or through a random generation system if the player prefers to use that.

Usurper is meant to scale from street-level to epic campaigns deciding the fate of kingdoms.

Emphasis is on providing as many tools as possible to generate worlds, cities and adventure ideas, allowing pick-up games with as little preparation work as possible.

boardgame.name: Ithaca in the Cards
boardgame.description:
You are fellow travellers on a perilous journey trying to make your way home. The goal of the game is to make it back safely. On your journey, you will encounter various challenges and reflect on what draws you home and spurs you on your journey.

This is a GM-less/GM-lite collaborative story game for 3-5 players. A game should take about 1-2 hours, and you will need a standard deck of playing cards, writing implements and paper or index cards to play.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Far From Home
boardgame.description:
Far From Home is a game about immigrants and outsiders. It’s about exploring what it means to live and thrive in a culture that is not fully your own. It’s about how you piece together an identity drawing from multiple cultures, yet never wholly belonging to either.

You will create Characters and define who they are in the beginning, how they see themselves in relation to their Home and to the Hegemony they now live in.

As you create your Characters, you will also create a Circle that ties your Characters together. The Circle provides a context for your Characters to work together and support each other, and it also provides something different that each of your Characters want or need.

You will then play to see how your characters struggle and change as their Home and the Hegemony struggle and change with them.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Wine, Wizards and Song
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Two wine merchants from Waterdeep set off from Good Mead with a sleigh filled with wine and mead pulled by two strong horses. When they fail to arrive in Easthaven it is feared they’ve lost their way.

Rumors abound of the wealth of these wine merchants, undead sightings near town, wizards causing mischief…. and did anyone hear that singing?

This is a Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Can You Tell Me How to Get to the East Haven Way?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While entering Good Mead, the party gets involved with a caravan merchant and a local brewer involving a missing shipment of Mead to Easthaven. Will the party be able to find out what happened to this shipment or will the people of Easthaven become angry due to the missing shipment?!

Adventure seed: Do You Know the way to Lonely Wood?

2 Hours of fun made for tier 1 Players with a recommended APL of 2. Maps are also as a side file as well as in the adventures.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Sort
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Efteråret havde sat sit præg på landskabet omkring de fem rejsende. Bladene hvirvlede i den kraftige vind, og i ny og næ begyndte regnen at piske mod de fems forpinte ansigter.

De havde rejst længe. Fra hvert sit sted, men med kun ét mål i øje: Devotienne! Dem frommeste by i verden. Den var målet for deres rejse, slutningen på deres trængsler. I hvert tilfælde for en stund. Da solen begyndte at synke mod vest, kunne de se slottet i byuen. De fem stolte tårne rejste sig mod himlen. Nede ib yen så de kirken, hvis spir pegede selvsikkert mod himlen, som ville det vise vejen. De små lave huse lå i ly af bymuren.

En af hestene stejlede, da de red gennem porten. Der var noget galt. Mellem to huse løb en hund ud og snappede efter rytternes ben mens den gøede. Og længere oppe af gaden kunne de høre ... musik?

boardgame.name: Blodig silke
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

De havde kørt et godt stykke, efter gadelygterne var ophørt. Det eneste, de havde at orientere sig efter, var de bleggule streger på vejen, der forvarslede et sving forude, når de pludseligt buede væk fra deres lige linie.

Rummet var stort, lige som de andre. Den kvalm ende lugt var blevet stærkere, og synet her hjalp ikke på det. Ching-Mei gav en kvækkende guttural lyd fra sig, vendte sig om og vaklede ud til badeværelset, hvor de forkvalte, hostende lyde ikke efterlod megen tvivl om hendes tilstand. De andre bevægede sig langsomt ind i rummet, der nu var blevet oplyst af loftslamperne, som Westmoore havde fået tændt. Der var meget blod næsten nyt kunne Patrick konstatere, idet han skrævede over en stiksamler. Balamenti bandede let, da han trådte på et eller andet skarpt: en blodig hobbykniv, der blandt de andre remedier havde været brugt til at forsage det frygtelige syn. Der var umiddelbart tre lig, alle nøgne. Melissa gav et gisp fra sig og blev ligbleg, da hun fjernede et silkelagen, for at afsløre endnu et. En lille pige ... næppe ældre end 12 år. Nøgen, bundet til den store ståldobbeltseng med kæmpereb og silketørklæder. Hendes tilstand overlod ikke meget til fantasien, om hvad der var hændt hende. Alec måtte give Ching-Mei selskab, men nåede ikke til badeværelset i tide.

En thriller/drama-hyldest til David Lynch og Clive Barker. Frarådes mindreårige spillere og folk med svage sjæle eller stærke moralbegreber.

boardgame.name: De helliges by
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Frk. Julie Angletere’s dagbog 16. juli det Herrens år 1187

Hvad skal der dog blive af os. De vantro er kommet, og vi måtte forlade Jerusalem i al hast. Sent på natten sprængte de vores sidste forsvarsværker, og vi måtte flygte. Den eneste grund til, at vi ikke blev dræbt, var, at Sir. Hacksfield kommandøren hjalp os ud.

Vi har bevæget os hele natten, og jeg er nu træt af at ride. Vi holder en kort pause, før vi rejser videre. Det er nu blevet morgen, og byen ligger allerede langt bag os. Jeg håber vi kan nå Beirut i løbet af en uge uden at blive fanget. Af den grund holder vi os mest til rejse om natten.

Måske er det her ikke så dårligt, som det ser ud. Nu har jeg måske chancen for at vende hjem til min kære fader i Bordeaux. Hvis bare ikke Richard holdt så meget fast i mig - jeg er træt af hans legen beskytter. Jeg kan tage vare på mig selv, og det burde han vide. Jeg håber ved Gud, at vi slipper væk herfra i live. Jeg vil ikke ende mit liv i de vantros hænder - jeg vil have en kristen - ikke en hedensk - begravelse.

Nå jeg må hellere slutte for i dag. De andre har fået øje på en fæstning i de fjerne. Den mener, at den er i kristne hænder, så jeg tror de vil spørge efter mad der. Hvis bare de ville fortælle mig hvad der foregår, men en ung kvinde får jo aldrig noget at vide.

Den høje araber trak langsomt sit sværd, samtidig med at han sporede sin hest. Nederst i dalen kunne han se den lille gruppe flygtninge. Disse vantro hunde skulle ikke have lov til at opleve endnu en solnedgang. Ved Allahs navn - disse hedninge skulle dø i dag. Han satte sporene i hestens side, og galoperede fremad skarp forfulgt af de andre, der også havde våbnene parat. Et enormt krigsråb gjaldede og snart efter var araberne fremme ved flygtningene.

Et drama om mødet mellem to kulturer, der måske ikke er så forskellige endda. Et drama om troen på en bedre fremtid, om forståelse mennesker imellem, om religion og middelalderens livsanskuelse.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as a ZIP archive containing nine DOC and three TTF (font) files, as well as an introductory text file.

boardgame.name: Paradox
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Forår, 1966. Nye strømninger inden for medier, mode og musik. Racespændinger i syden, en eskalerende landkrig i fjernøsten og et kapløb i rummet drevet af den kolde krig. Informationsteknologien skaber nye vaner og visioner for fremtiden. Om få år vil farvefjernsynet være allemandseje og verden være forandret. Stjernerne har stået helt rigtigt for dig, og nu har du chancen for at spille en nøglerolle i at forme den fremtid.

Paradox foregår i de smukke Adirondacksbjerge, upstate New York. En håndfuld unge, håbefulde reklamefolk er hyret til at udtænke en kampagne for et banebrydende nyt farvefjernsyn. Spillerne indtager rollen som storbymennesker, der bliver revet ud af deres vante rammer, da de besøger en vigtig kunde i hans luksussommerhus ved Paradox Lake. Her konfronteres de både med naturens blændende skønhed og en snigende ondskab. En mørk vilje hviler i det frodige bakkelandskab, og hen over weekenden udspiller sig et mysterie, der kan koste hovedpersonerne både liv og sjæl.

Spiller: Du er med til selv at bygge din karakter op – og får rig lejlighed til at bryde den ned igen i mødet med ubegribelig ondskab. Der er ikke lagt op til forløsende actionsekvenser.

Spilleder: Du skal formidle stemning, understøtte spillernes kreativitet og rollespille et lille galleri af sære bipersoner. Der er ikke noget sindrigt plot eller komplekse regler at holde styr på.

boardgame.name: Princess Quest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Har du nogensinde tænkt på, hvad Disneyfigurerne laver, når filmen er slut? Lever alle de smukke prinsesser et lykkeligt og roligt liv til deres dages ende med Prinsen på den hvide hest? I Princess Quest har de smukke prinssesser – udover deres job i Disneyland – en ny og hårdtslående hobby hvor de bekæmper kriminelle af enhver slags. I dette første scenarie øver en ukendt bagmand angreb på Disneyland og på de mange turister. Prinsesserne bliver sat på opgaven med at finde ud af, hvem der vil ødelægge Disneyland. De må gøre det med livet som indsats, efterhånden som bagmanden fortsætter sine angreb. Heldigvis er de både snarrådige og hårdtslående! Få udlevet dine prinsessedrømme og bekæmp forbrydere som en ægte Disneyprinsesse!

Spiller: Lidt kendskab til de mest almindelige Disneyfilm er en fordel, men ikke nødvendigt. Alle køn og aldersgrupper er velkomne, så længe man har en indre Disneyprinsesse (og hvem har ikke det?). Tiara er optional.

Spilleder: God til at improvisere og hjælpe med at holde en let og legende stil. Kendskab til de største Disneyklassikere.

boardgame.name: Unworthy
boardgame.description: Steam description - UNWORTHY is a hardcore combat-focused metroidvania without jumping. Explore a grim universe, discover new weapons and abilities, and defeat the vile creatures that plague the land.

boardgame.name: the static speaks my name
boardgame.description: Steam description - A dark/sad/weird/funny first person exploration game. You play a man on his last night alive as he obsesses over a mysterious painting. More of a story game in that it emphasizes mood and character over gameplay. Takes ten minutes to play and has "next-gen" features like a shrimp tank.

boardgame.name: Silver Grapple
boardgame.description: Steam description - A fast paced platformer that has you swinging through the air at the speed of sound! Run, jump and fling your way through the ruins of an abandoned laboratory as you master the physics of the Silver Grappling Hook.

boardgame.name: Razed
boardgame.description: Steam description - Neon-infused high-speed platformer where the rules are simple - blast though levels as fast as you can! But there's a catch. If you go too slow, you explode! Unlock skills and powers, and seek out shortcuts to propel yourself to the top of the online leaderboards.

boardgame.name: Fungus of the Underdark Companion Guide: Fungus is Fun Stuff
boardgame.description:
"An illustrated digital companion guide for dungeon masters and players traversing the Underdark... This supplement can be used for campaigns and one-shots set in the Underdark."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.description:
WILD: Serengeti is a board game inspired by the endless plains of the Serengeti. This game combines the joy of puzzle-solving with elements of set-collection and engine-building to create a deep and unique strategic experience. The mesmerizing artwork, 3D components and detailed animeeples will guide you straight into the vivid and breathtaking wilds of the Serengeti.

In order to gain victory points, the player must complete Scene Cards by placing the animals on the Main Board in the same pattern as shown on the cards.

To achieve the pattern shown on the Scene Cards, players perform actions to either place or move animals on the Main Board. When animals are placed on the Main Board in the same pattern as displayed on the Scene Card, the scene can be completed. When completing Scene Cards the player receives ‘Icons’ or ‘Rewards’. With Rewards, players can earn points or different resources, and with Icons, gain continuous benefits throughout the game.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Wer hat dich, du schÃ¶ner Wald..
boardgame.description:
Players use magnets to remove items from the forest. If animals are removed, minus points are given. The player tallies up his points at the end and the one with the most points is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Nekopara â Catboys Paradise
boardgame.description: Furries

boardgame.name: Cuboid Keeper
boardgame.description: Steam description - Cuboid Keeper is a fast-paced arena shooter with a gripping storyline and an unique spaceship building system. Take control of the legendary Guardian of the Cube and face four advanced civilizations hell-bent on defeating you.

boardgame.name: Pirate Box
boardgame.description:
You've finally managed to get your hands on the legendary Black Lemon treasure. To share the loot, you set up an old pirate tradition in 3 steps:


memorize the contents of the chest in 30 seconds,
plan the sharing of the loot on a common grid,
then each collect the objects in the chest according to your choices.


In short, place your pirate tiles on the grid alternately beginning by the first player. Then look what treasure pieces correspond to your grid placement and score the maximum of points by all available combinations. (crown crown, mask, bottle, sword, coin, diamond). Shake the chest, change the content of it and start again !

If you have a good memory and are smarter than your partners, you might get the most valuable loot back!

—description from the publisher

Title: Pirate Box Publisher: Blue Orange Language(s): English German French Dutch Spanish Italian Portugese

boardgame.name: Moss Mouse's Metallurgy
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Moss and his mice live and work in the twisty lands of the Divot Mines. At the end of the line, tunneled in the Earth, is Moss’s Metallurgy. Layered with work stations and oddballs the temperamental Moss is renowned for his craftsmanship and deadly weapons.

A 4 page adventure site with some Maps, Hooks, Beasts, and ordinary keys turned into glorious mousey weaponry and armor!

boardgame.name: We Can't Stop Here...
boardgame.description:
From the description:

"We can't stop here..." is a Mörk Borg supplement about a wagon filled with magical herbs that would make any occult herbmaster wet their pants from excitement.

There are 8 pages of material about the wagon and the surrounding lore plus a short 7 page adventure "... this is bat country" that let's the party discover the wagon and possibly get revenge on their dead friends in the hands of bat-men.

Contains rules for: Consuming the contents of the unlabelled jars of the wagon. The morning after. Visions that can be gained from beyond. Traveling with the strange wagon that might not want to go anywhere. Random encounters while traveling with the wagon. And descriptions of Yrtlepakko (The Bat of the Herbs) and the skull that sits on top of the wagon.

Content warning: Substance abuse (fantasy drugs), religious fanaticism, violence.

boardgame.name: Spire of Uhlunar
boardgame.description:
From the description:

When the saints of the Dead King overcame the curse of age they started to build toward the stars.

For in life undying they remembered the soil and the millions their quest had interred there.

You remember also, as you climb with righteous anger.

Spire of Uhlunar is an explicitly antifascist re-imagining of spire cities of a certain popular grimdark science fiction skirmish game.

This Mini-Zine contains six backgrounds from the underspire of Uhlunar, and its people, as they fight their way upwards, with the dead of murdered world at their backs.

boardgame.name: Electric Friends
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

You've been hired to scavenge a long-forgotten robot factory and failure is not an option!

Electric Friends is a 3rd level adventure, written for Star Crawl but fully compatible with DCC & MCC (and easily converted for use with any sci-fi rules).

Electric Friends is the second standalone Star Crawl adventure. It includes pre-generated characters & ship stats to get you right into the action!

Special bonus content includes the Space Cowboy class and Rodent race template!

36 B&W pages, presented by Tuesday Night Fiend Club
boardgame.rpg: Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Despertar del Pez del Viento
Wake of the Wind Fish
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Wake of the Wind Fish, a group of level-4 adventurers visits a water genasi settlement called Zorannia. A mysterious astral fey fish visits the town once a year. The locals call it the Wind Fish and see its annual visits as a source of good fortune and fertility. Something terrible a few days ago when the Wind Fish came for its expected visit. It was sick and weak. A priestess tried to help it but got swallowed in the process to the horror of perplexed bystanders.

An old taboo prevents the genasi from following the Wind Fish to its refuge in the mountain, an ancient temple abandoned generations ago. A drow guide and researcher in town, named Falandir, knows the way up the mountain and is the only person in town willing to investigate the Wind Fish, apart from the adventurers. What no one knows is that an evil creature within the astral fish makes it sick. This quest shall bring the adventurers to the Wind Fish innards to find the malignant parasite.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Despertar del Pez del Viento PDF

boardgame.name: Gothic Adventures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fight the darkness …or become it!

Resist the siren call of the ocean as a deep one, sharpen your fangs and hunt vampires as a dhampir, rebel against your creator as a golemkin, fight your violent side as a jekyll, howl at the moon with your lycan brothers, preserve your bloodline as one of the undying, or skulk in plain sight as one of the unseen.

Will the darkness in your soul consume you, or will you rise above it to fight the creeping uberwald, a manifestation of a powerful evil creature's corruption? The choice is yours, but be warned: few escape the horrors of a gothic horror setting with their sanity intact!

This campaign setting features new rules for bonds, sanity, and madness; rules for creating gothic environments known as an uberwald; the five stages of transformation; 7 new species, 9 new feats, 18 new subclasses, 22 new subspecies, 24 new monsters, and 25 new spells.

boardgame.name: DICED
boardgame.description:
A family card game where the roll of the dice, decides a players fate.

Included items:
58 Playing Cards
1 Rule card
1 Playing die

The aim of the game is for players to loose all their cards. Each player is dealt 7 cards at the start of the game. Each player then takes it in turns to roll the die to try and match the number with the number on their cards. If the numbers match, the player can put down the matching cards. If the numbers do not match, the player than has to pick up 1 card from the separate pile. sound simple enough? well... some of the numbered cards have symbols on them that can power certain activities in the game. These symbols include... Role again, next player pick up x4, Change direction, Next player miss a go. These cards can be great to trip up opponents or launch you towards victory. In the game there are also special cards. The 'CHOICE' card allows a player to put down a card, no matter the number they roll. Meaning a player with this in hand can always be saved, If a player is clever they may choose to keep hold of tis card.
The 'STEAL' card will cause wars and arguments. This card allows a player to steal any opponents roll, at any point in the game. Meaning a player can put down their cards and the player that stole the roll can put down theirs. This card can flip a game on its head and launch players into the lead.

A game full of twists and turns, but to win this game do you need luck or skill? we will let you decide.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Ruins of High Hill
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Raspberry Hills seem a mystical place made to inspire artists with its blossoming summer months. People from the neighboring towns and manors make their way here to pick raspberries during the day and celebrate in the evenings. Most would gather at the center of the fields, atop the highest hill where the ruins of an ancient structure sit, its origins long forgotten. But this season abruptly ended. Persistent nightmares thought to originate from the crumbling keep drove the panicked attendees away. The fear and dread grow every day, as if something diabolical is about to unfold.

The Ruins of High Hill is a Q-Crawl, or Quick-Crawl, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 15th-level characters. This crawl would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Purple Orb Species Reforged
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment of Star Log.Deluxe includes: purple orbs! The happy glowy species that's perfect for violet violence in the far-flung future. Included within are species traits for purple orbs, a slew of purple orb heritages, and new purple orb talents available for all purple orb characters.

boardgame.name: Aetherjack's Almanac Numbers One Through Six
Ãtherjack's Almanac Numbers One Through Six
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

How exactly do golden barges traverse the humpbacked sky?

The anti-canonical answer to that is found here in the first issue of Ætherjack’s Almanac. Covering the three most common forms of engines, an unemployed elemental background, and npc statistics for air and fire elementals.

Issue Two of ÆTHERJACK’S ALMANAC your source for semi-weird space-fantasy for Troika! is here in both eye rending color and safe for life black & white. Contains one background, stats for a warship, stats for two different NPC versions of the warship. Conversion from the vintage science-fantasy setting not enough people love & brief combat rules for space combat.

Number 3 includes description of a small personal craft built and primarily piloted by moon-rats for divers purposes, mostly defending ætherjammers from pirates, scouting areas, or some light mercenary work. Included are simple rules for engaging ætherjammers with such craft and personal weapons.

Number 4 includes a person cybernetically and permanently bonded to a small golden barge, who has to work off mega credits of student loan debt incurred from being enrolled at birth.

A roomba with a knife.

Classifications of Spheres and why you use golden sails and not rocket engines.

Number 5 contains ship cards with stats for the following craft:

Ætherat WNG-F/LC Twin-Engine Winged Ferry/Light Cargo Æthercraft

Swyver no. 3 Fighter Æthercraft

L5er Fritillary Multi-Purpose Light Æthercraft

Number 6 Contains:

A derelict AI controlled warship background

Stats for both a derelict and peak version of the Iridium Frigate

NPC stats for cybernetic corpse soldiers

boardgame.name: Underneath
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the planet Bannerjee, millions of lives are at stake, only they don’t know it. A probe sent by the world’s scientists has all the answers — at least it did until it disappeared. The adventurers are hired to find and retrieve it and the precious data it carries, but unknown forces menace both them and the information. If the data isn’t returned before disaster strikes, Bannerjee will become the latest in a long list of worlds the interstellar government considers dead.

Underneath is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: Underwater Cities: TowerRex Insert
boardgame.description:
In our dire times of overpopulation, you will be the person to find it in the depths of the sea. Finding a solution to such a task under mental and physical pressure is not an easy one, so we decided to make a small upgrade of an underwater city-base for you to have a start - an organizer for the Underwater Cities boardgame.

Features:
- With this organizer, you will spend time only on building new tunnels, making scientific breakthroughs and making one more cup of tea for the evening with your family and friends;
- All the trays are easily removed from the box, so you can set up and manage the table in any comfortable way;
- The organizer is stylized to be an underwater scientific base;
- The organizer supports all the promos;
- The organizer supports sleeved cards of up to 60 microns (MayDay, UltraPro, etc.);
- The organizer is made out of HDF and Acryl;
- It also might be the best way to please your fellow scientist with a small gift;
- The assembly is easy and you will enjoy the game within 20 minutes.

Important point! You will need the base game box and the New Discoveries expansion box to store all the game components. All the maps go to the expansion box.

The organizer comprises of:
- Cardholder for all the cards;
- Covered tray for all the metropolis, tunnels and multiplier tiles;
- Covered tray for all the city domes and tokens;
- Tray for all the buildings' tokens;
- Tray for credit tokens;
- 5 covered trays for the players;

The organizer supports:
- New Discoveries Expansion;
- All the Promos.

One organizer to hold them all!

boardgame.name: Der Foliant (Issue 1 - 1987)
boardgame.description:
Heldentypen für DSA (Drachentöter, Rahja-Geweihte)
kurzer Bericht von MART 2
Der Ghoul (Kreatur für DSA)
Werkstattbericht & Fragen (Schwertmeister 2)
system-unabhängiges Abenteuer (Die Falle der Sabbals)
Rezensionen
Kleinanzeigen
u.a.m.

boardgame.name: Maximum Apocalypse: VerwÃ¼stete Lande
Maximum Apocalypse: Wasted Wilds
boardgame.description:
Maximum Apocalypse: Wasted Wilds is the much anticipated continuation of the hit cooperative roguelike game series. It features the same compelling survival gameplay but adds two distinct campaigns with a lot of new twists around exposure to the elements and interactions with other survivors. It features four new characters, two distinct campaigns, new mechanics, and tons of new monsters and apocalypses to face.

Wasted Wilds can be played as a stand-alone 1-4 player campaign, or combined with the contents of any other Maximum Apocalypse game or expansion to support up to 6 players. Survivors from Maximum Apocalypse, Kaiju Rising, Gothic Horrors and Jurassic Perils are all fully playable in this game. Plus any of the new survivors from Wasted Wilds can be played in the other Maximum Apocalypse games as well!

If you're unfamiliar with Maximum Apocalypse, it is a cooperative roguelike game filled with adventure, exploration, survival and strategic choices. It was built from the ground up to be very modular and infinitely replayable. Maximum Apocalypse has inspired a Role Playing Game and spawned numerous expansions featuring everything from Bugs, C'thulhu and Kaiju. There is a vast wasteland out there to explore and Wasted Wilds has been designed as the perfect starting point! The Frozen Wilds campaign walks players through a mission by mission tutorial that will ease new players into the experience.

—description from the designer

listing.notes: *** PREORDER WITH EXPECTED DELIVERY Q2 2022*** Contents: Kickstarter Edition of Maximum Apocalypse: Wasted Wilds Board Game by Rock Manor Games. Includes core game, Time Traveler Expansion, Few and the Cursed Expansion, and all unlocked stretch goals. This is a stand-alone expansion for Maximum Apocalypse board game. It can be played separately, or in combination with any other Maximum Apocalypse title. Order this Board Game now and Get FREE SHIPPING in the Continental US! Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: Aloha! Burger
boardgame.description:
Let's have a nervous breakdown with the ingredient card. You can make a Kua Aina hamburger by stacking the cards you got!

Players take turns sitting and memorize the front of an ingredient card that is then placed face down. Next. ingredient cards are flipped over and players have to find the match. Players can keep flipping cards until they have made a mistake. Then the mistake card stays flipped over and the turn goes to the player on the left. When the order is complete that player takes all the ingredient cards. Turn ingredients into the most burgers to win the game.

A collaboration between Daiso and the Kua 'Aina Sandwich shop in Hawaii/London/Japan.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

boardgame.name: Der Orkbote Spezial 1: Rauben, PlÃ¼ndern, Morden
boardgame.description:
The first special issue of Orkbote collects, revises and enlarges the scenario published in Orkbote ##1-3. It is set in Rohan, the player characters are orcs and trolls.

16 pages + 7 inlays.

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Wars: Duel â Extinction
ÐÐ¾Ð¹Ð½Ñ ÐÑÑÐ»Ñ Ñ: ÐÑÑÐ»Ñ. ÐÑÐ¼Ð¸ÑÐ°Ð½Ð¸Ðµ
boardgame.description:
The Old Ones have risen. Monsters walk the Earth. Humanity is finished, but the struggle continues. Which Great Old One will rule the ruins of Earth? Now, you take charge!

Cthulhu Wars Duel: Extinction is a fast-moving two-player strategy game in which you play as The Sleeper, primordial god of slumber and hunger or Ithaqua, the Windwalker, god of outer space and all that is coldest and darkest. Each side is strikingly different with unique units, abilities, and strategies available.

Cthulhu Wars Duel: Extinction is fully compatible with the original Cthulhu Wars Duel game. Both are standalone products, but Factions and Maps can be mixed and matched in any combination!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Port Pauline
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Tucked in a little cove surrounded by steep cliff sit the overturned remains of the Pauline, an ancient Titan ship. It’s here where Pegleg Pepe and his fierce band of pirate parrots have built Port Pauline, their base of operations for preying on travelers, seafaring merchants, and even other Pirate bands.

boardgame.name: Res Arcana: Lux et Tenebrae â Alternative Mages Card Pack
Res Arcana: Lux et Tenebrae â Alternative Magierkarten
boardgame.description: A pack of alternative mages for Res Arcana: Lux et Tenebrae.

[size=12][b]Wise:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Wise (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and charges the sender a fee of about 0.5% of the amount of money sent.
[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money.

Price: $5 + shipping (tracking required, inquire for quote)
Paypal and Venmo accepted.

boardgame.name: Iconoclash: Battlegrounds
boardgame.description:
Iconoclash: Battlegrounds is a stand-alone expansion and features 4 new, original fighters for the Iconoclash system:


Valiant Knight: Press-your-luck with every attack! The Valiant Knight commands an army of champions, and his attack deals more when he draws well from his Valiant Token Bag. But with every draw you risk the attack with a chance he may weaken his attacks or cause them to fail altogether.
Amelia Fortress: Ready to take command of the fight? The undauntable commander of the 6th Armored Brigade will pulverize her opponents with her heavily armed mecha. She tends to pull off her greatest maneuvers when she's on the ropes and has only a handful of options.
Monarch: Prepare to take flight and control the skies! Monarch readies her lance from above to deal extra damage. Monarch will use her magnificent wings to create great gusts and push everything on the board.
Kali: Put on your uwu face! Kali commands an army of alien kittens that she uses to create an adorable minefield. Or she can collect them to create an explosion of kitten power.


In Iconoclash: Battlegrounds you’ll take the fight to the Final Battlefield and the Fallen Field where great battles in ages past have been fought.

boardgame.name: LIGHT: Kingslayer
boardgame.description:
In this new Strike for GilaRPGs' Light, the Beacons are summoned by an ancient story and mysterious message to an ancient crypt. The Beacons must descend into the darkness, and fight a series of new foes. Gain new weapons, fight through the underground, and slay the ancient evil, the Undying King.

Included in this game are three new enemy types for Light, a new boss, several new weapons, and an ancient elemental sword.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Catgirl Handbook
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This handbook is the cat’s meow!

Find all new options that help you or your fuzzy friends pounce, wiggle, and purr their way to victory! Harness the inheritor’s blade Expawlibur or outfit your adventurers with comfortable boxes and all sorts of strains of recreational catnip! Charm and politely possess others as the form-cursed matagot wraith, weave purrfect melodies as a purrsician bard, or call upon your meowdolon to crush your enemies!

This handbook includes new archetypes, talents, feats, racial traits and character traits, equipment, magic items, drugs, and bestiary entries for every feline enthusiast or connoisseur.

The Catgirl Handbook is a Pathfinder 1st edition supplement for Ultimate Spheres of Power as well as materials from Spheres of Might, Champions of the Spheres, and other Drop Dead Studio products.

boardgame.name: April in Fishsmouth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The town of Fishsmouth may be pretty but it is not quiet: a creature prowls near the Docks, shadows run on the rooftops, the inhabitants are all strange...
But you, you are just passing by and you're bored.
So when a goldfish goes missing, you see it as a way to kill time like any other !

(This scenario was written for April's fool)
Every Monday, discover a new monster and its quick plot-hook : a psychic parasite, a cursed item, a monstrous insect....

"Adventures of the Week" is a series of scenario, quick to read and to add to your play nights, whether to complete an ongoing campaign, to start one or simply for a one-shot !
They are not written for a specific system or universe in order to let you modify and develop them at will.
Contains

a quick-to-read plot-hook,
exclusive illustration for the monster,
a description of the creature.


La ville de Fishsmouth est peut être jolie mais elle n’est pas tranquille : une créature rôde près des Quais, des ombres court sur les toits, les habitants sont tous étranges...
Mais vous, vous n’êtes que de passage et vous vous ennuyez.
Alors quand un poisson rouge disparaît, vous y voyez un passe-temps comme un autre !

(Scénario écrit pour le 1e Avril)
Chaque semaine, découvrez un nouveau monstre accompagnez de son amorce de scénario : un parasite psychique, un objet maudit, un insecte monstrueux...

"Adventures of the Week" est une série de scénarios rapide à lire et à incorporer dans vos soirées de jeux, que ce soit pour compléter une campagne, en commencer une ou simplement pour un one-shot !
Ils ne sont pas écrits pour un système ou un univers en particulier afin de vous permettre de les modifier et les développer à volonté.

Contient :

une amorce de scénario rapide à lire,
une illustration exclusive du monstre,
une description de la créature.

boardgame.name: BattleTech Adventures: Escape from Castle Wulfensteiner
Escape from Castle Wulfensteiner
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Someone’s Alive Down There!”

The Inner Sphere may be going to hell in a handbasket, but you are your team managed to land a gig far from the swirling chaos. Protecting a DropShip-load of Deep Periphery explorers picking over remnants of the long-lost Rim Worlds Republic may not be glamorous or exciting, but it pays well enough.

Then came the strange transmission from the latest destination—a dry, dusty, poisonous world in the middle of nowhere:

“Hail, unidentified vessel! You have entered Star League Imperial airspace without a recognized flight plan! Please declare yourselves and your intentions at once!”

BattleTech Adventures: Escape from Castle Wulfensteiner takes players to the forgotten worlds of the Deep Periphery, in search of mysteries lost to time and treachery. After three years of exploring, the search has finally come to SLSC A8V.24881. Escape from Castle Wulfensteiner includes a guide to this desolate world, personal biographies on several key players, and adventure Tracks designed for use with A Time of War: The BattleTech Role-Playing Game, A Time of War Companion, and MechWarrior: Destiny, as well as special rules and Record Sheets for key non-player characters and facilities unique to this story.
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech Adventures: War of the Tripods
War of the Tripods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“A Million to One,” They Said…

The year is 3138. Behind the walls of the “Fortress”, the stormy world of Bryant remains cut off from interstellar communications, apparently ignored by the rest of the Republic of the Sphere. Just as the usual cycle of continent-spanning “hypercanes” gives way to a pleasant, crop-friendly Calm Season in the planet’s polar hinterlands, local communications break down amid the worrying rumors of fireballs streaking through the northern skies.

Have invaders from beyond the Republic actually made it through the Walls?

BattleTech Adventures: War of the Tripods takes players to the world of Bryant, inside the boundaries of “Fortress Republic”—a minor world, all-but overlooked by the universe around it, until the arrival of mysterious invaders. Can a team of local defenders turn back the attackers before it’s too late? War of the Tripods includes a guide to this world, personal biographies on several key players, and adventure Tracks designed for use with A Time of War: The BattleTech Role-Playing Game and the A Time of War Companion, as well as special rules, equipment, maps, and Record Sheets for key non-player characters and equipment unique to this story.
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech Adventures: Empires Aflame
Empires Aflame
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There May be Some Turbulence…

The year is 3095. Ten years after the Jihad, peace has finally reached most of the Inner Sphere. Within the newly created Republic of the Sphere, the post-war drawdowns have made industry of disarmament. But even here, not every mission goes smoothly—for, sometimes, the universe itself has its own agenda!

BattleTech Adventures: Empires Aflame takes players into a whole new adventure, when a misjump during a routine mission strands the crew far from home. Can your team discover where they’ve come, and escape to tell the tale? Empires Aflame includes a guide to a whole new area of BattleTech lore, complete with personal biographies on several key players, and adventure Tracks designed for use with A Time of War: The BattleTech Role-Playing Game and A Time of War Companion, as well as special rules, map, and Record Sheets for key non-player characters unique to this story.
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Brachyura of the Deeps - A Troika! Background
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a new background for Troika! Numinous Edition, for an enormous deep-sea crustacean.

This is a single page layered PDF. See the video for printing help.

Compatible with Troika! "Brachyura of the Deeps" is an independent production by Azukail Games and is not affiliated with the Melsonian Arts Council.

boardgame.name: NÃ¤hdÃ¤Ã¤n TÃ¤l Pual Jokke
boardgame.description:
Trivia game about one of Finland's major cities, Turku. The game has 936 questions and is suitable for everyone who wants to learn more about Finland's former capital, Turku.

The name of the game refers to the old saying in the Turku dialect meaning "This side of the river" (as opposed to "The other side of the river") and refers to the river Aura which splits the city in two, into "old" and "new" parts. "This side of the river" is the old part with the cathedral, old city halls and market square etc., while the actual city center is now in the new part "on the other side".

The game is basically the Turku edition of NÃ¤hdÃ¤Ã¤n Kellon Alla, the original version set in Helsinki.

boardgame.name: Experimental Technical Readout: Caveat Emptor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After Gray Monday, the Republic has descended into a new Dark Age, ploughshares are being turned back into swords, and the jackals are feeding on the confusion. The desperate need for weapons of new militaries arising everywhere sees mundane machines strapped with outlandish weapons, flamboyant arena ’Mechs returning to the battlefield, and renowned manufacturers engaging in uncharacteristic experimental gambles. It is a seller’s market; anything goes and no price is too high. Caveat emptor—the dust will settle quicker on your new acquisition’s battlefield debut than on the transaction that got you there. You won’t have time for buyer’s remorse.

Experimental Technical Readout: Caveat Emptor samples production and prototype machines that have earnt infamy after Gray Monday as inefficient monstrosities sold to the highest bidder. Each unit featured in this book incorporates some of the new technologies that debuted in Tactical Operations (or quirks found in the BattleMech Manual)—now employed on battlefields of brush wars on former Republic worlds. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new advanced and experimental BattleMechs, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Dumpster Fire
boardgame.description:
Created for TrashJam 2020, Dumpster Fire is the perfect Lasers and Feelings hack for a socially isolated world.

You are various trash creatures living in a common dumpster. The dumpster is your home, your source of safety, and your source of food. Despite your differences, protecting the dumpster is paramount.

Choose to play as either a Trash Connoisseur (rat), Trash Panda (raccoon), Trash Screamer (opossum), or Trash Lit (book) and gain the appropriate abilities, then decorate your dumpster, and prepare for disaster!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: EGO
boardgame.description:
A short single player TTRPG about trying to love yourself. You will write the epic tale of a hero's life long quest to leave their mark on the world, leveling up and gaining power, items and allies as you engage in acts of self love or self improvement.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: ERRANCE
boardgame.description:
Every life counts.
Every story is worth recounting.
Exist. Tell. Spread your story.


forced departure, loneliness, hardships, uncertainties, :hopes... This is:

ERRANCE
it means "roaming" in french

To play, you'll need one six-sided dice (D6) and a pen. Print, fold, cut, play. Tell the story and hopes of the game's only character, alone or collectively in a small group. You can then leave the booklet somewhere, so that it can be found by someone else... or share your message of hope or support in the comments (or on social networks by writing #CorazonBundle).

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: ç½ã¨é»ã§ããªã (Trick-Taking in Black and White)
boardgame.description:
In ç½ã¨é»ã§ããªã (Trick-Taking in Black and White), each of the 36 cards has two suits — black and white — and the numbers on a card always add up to 37, e.g., 11 black and 26 white.

At the start of a round, deal the deck evenly to all players. Whoever leads the round plays a card from their hand and chooses either black or white as the suit. All other players play a card of their choice, then whoever played the highest number in the chosen suit collects the trick (recording in some manner whether the trick was white or black), then leads the next trick.

Once all the cards have been played, players score their collected tricks. If you have taken an equal number of black tricks and white tricks, then you score positive points equal to the number of tricks collected; if not, you score negative points equal to the number of tricks collected. After a certain number of rounds, whoever has the highest score wins.

Not to be confused with En Blanc et Noir, a very similar looking and titled game from the same publisher.

listing.notes:
Can you win the same number of tricks --in both black and white?

In this game, all cards have two suits: black and white! It is a must-follow game, where the highest card of the lead suit wins. This game includes an English rule book.
If you want to find more description, please check below link. https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/335467/trick-taking-black-and-white

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us. We appreciate your patience as it might take 2-3 days for reply.

boardgame.name: Bees vs. Bears
boardgame.description:
Bees vs. Bears is a strategy card game in which you play as a hive of bees, defending your honey against the horde of hungry bears. Each player starts with two honey tokens and tries to outlast the other hives. During the game you use special abilities as well as your army of bee defenders, attempting to simultaneously fend of the bears and weaken the other hives!

Bees vs. Bears is a high action, fast paced game with games averaging 10 - 20 minutes. It can be played with 2-6 people and though the game is easy to pick up, it is hard to master as there are sixty different cards, some with more complicated abilities than others.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mystery Case Files: The Countess
boardgame.description:
Lady Eleanor Codington, prominent friend of the Queen herself, has disappeared while renovating her family’s legendary estate. Explore the crumbling grounds of world-famous children’s author Gloria Codington for clues. A towering black mirror may reveal a secret, but gazing into its depths may bring more than just a few years of bad luck. Can you find Eleanor and escape the manor alive? Find out in this heart-pounding hidden-object puzzle adventure game!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Songbirds - Core Rule Book
boardgame.description:
"What if knights didn't slay dragons and instead helped them with their emotional issues?"

That was the thought that spawned Songbirds, and it aims to carry forward the idea of combating those intangible things that we struggle with on a daily basis. I know I've wanted to punch my anxiety in the face on numerous occasions. Well, now we can. Together.

This game has:

(32 unique classes that you won't find in other games

Choose a genre to show your characters aesthetic
Hearts that you can trade to form bonds and relationships
Stress mechanics that take over for health/damage
And a basic contest system that uses ALL dice in a standard dice set
Not to mention that the book is 100 pages (50-odd spreads), and the ENTIRE back half of the book is dedicated to giving you tools to run the game! It includes



Principles and Tip
Methods for creating villages
NPC generation with the unique "Three Things" system
Creating adventures using songs
A simple Opponent generation system that allows you to focus on language over crunch


This is a game for fans of classic anime, cartoons, action, adventure, and all flavors of heroics. You will make an entire unique character every single time you start a campaign, and explore personal areas that are meant to challenge your character specifically.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: 36 apples
boardgame.description: Steam description - Collect apples and uncover the secrets of a self-contained world.

boardgame.name: Darkness Within: Age of Fantasy â Narrative Campaign
boardgame.description:
Darkness Within is a narrative campaign for Age of Fantasy that follows the story of Misha, a young princess who must rise to the challenge and reclaim her throne after a vampire uprising brings darkness to the realm.

This game expansion for Age of Fantasy takes players on an adventure across 10 missions which are tied together by an exciting story of epic proportions.
Rules for unit progression are also included, so you can watch your armies grow and evolve throughout the campaign.

Even though this narrative campaign was written with Humans and Vampiric Undead in mind, it is easy to imagine this type of clash to be happening between any of the other factions in the world, so feel free to swap them out with whatever armies you have available to play.

Note that to play this campaign you’re going to need the core rules for Age of Fantasy as well as some army lists, which you can find for free on onepagerules website.

boardgame.name: Altdorf: Crown of the Empire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Altdorf is the capital city of the Empire and the birthplace of Sigmar Heldenhammer. It is the most populous city in the Old World, and the site of several famous and majestic landmarks. The Imperial Palace and the Grand Cathedral of Sigmar are monumental edifices, larger than whole districts of smaller cities. The Colleges of Magic tower over the banks of fog that blow in off the Reik, venting gouts of sorcerous fire and fume. Altdorf has another side to it, in the teeming rookeries of the East End and the bustling Dockland to the north, gangland intimidation and revolutionary fervour are felt more keenly than the word of Sigmar’s priests, or the rule of the Emperor’s laws.

Altdorf: Crown of the Empire is a fascinating and entertaining 224-page guidebook to the capital. Standing on the confluence of two of the greatest rivers in the Empire, Altdorf is a nexus of power: government, religion, magic and military. Each district is carefully detailed with a wide variety of locations, plot hooks, and NPCs. A beautifully illustrated map, provided with both GM and Player versions, shows off the expansive city in exquisite detail. Whether Players wish to explore the Street of a Hundred Taverns, involve themselves in intrigues at the Imperial Palace, seek to topple the established order alongside Altdorf’s revolutionary factions, or dominate the city’s underworld as part of the warring dockland gangs, the book has all you need.

Altdorf: Crown of the Empire is extensively researched; combining details derived from over 30 years, including stories, sourcebooks, and roleplaying scenarios, with new material to create the ultimate sourcebook for thrilling adventures in the capital. Old favourites such as ‘Filthy’ Harald Kleindeinst and Rosanna Ophuls are updated to be used in the fourth edition of Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay. Characters from Warhammer Fantasy Battle with links to Altdorf, such as Reiksmarshal Kurt Helborg and Supreme Patriarch Thyrus Gormann, are described in detail. A host of new NPCs have been added to illustrate the vast diversity of folk who call the capital their home.

Whilst Altdorf: Crown of the Empire contains enough plot hooks and interesting locations to be the site of hundreds of adventures, it is also a perfect complement to the Enemy Within campaign. The Characters may turn the fleeting visits to Altdorf described in Enemy in Shadows, Death on the Reik and Power Behind the Throne into detailed explorations. The capital will also play a pivotal role in the forthcoming fifth part of the campaign, Empire in Ruins.

Altdorf: Crown of the Empire includes:


A History of Altdorf: A timeline of events leading up to the present day, detailing the city’s past as the centre of Unberogen power in the Reikland and the centre of Sigmar’s Empire. Myths and legends associated with the area and the great men and women who have contributed to Altdorf’s cultural pre-eminence, past and present.



How Altdorf is Ruled: A detailed examination of both secular and religious power in Altdorf, and the checks nobles from other provinces attempt to place upon them. The major knightly orders that call the city home are described. On the streets of the East End and Dockland the power of the gangs has as much impact as the edicts of the House of the Third Wilhelm, and their organisations and methods are the subject of numerous articles and adventure hooks.



A Visitors Guide: The city is divided into three great quarters, each comprised of several distinct districts. There is the wealthy South Bank, centre of religious and political power, the City North, a buzzing commercial hub and home of the Colleges of Magic, and the East End, a maze of decaying rookeries and noisome industrial sprawl.



Altdorfers: Over 45 NPCs are examined in detail, providing a broad selection of the great city’s citizens and denizens. From penniless revolutionaries and forlorn mutants to the worthies of Altdorf’s court. The peculiarities of what life is like for Altdorf’s Elves, Dwarfs, and Halflings is examined, and lurking in the city’s dark are Skaven agents, and the followers of Chaos gods.



Beneath the Streets and Beyond the Walls: Altdorf extends down into the mud and beyond its walls. Visitors arriving on foot from Nuln are treated to the booming and flashing of the Artillery Fields, whilst those from Marienburg are assailed by the magnificent sight (and ammonium stench) of Altdorf’s Demigryph pens. Beneath the city, the Dwarfs labour to prevent the flooding of their ancient subterranean district, whilst monsters and cultists stalk through the catacombs.



And more: The cultural life of Altdorf has options for rich, poor and middle class; the skill of psychometry can be learned by those with the talent for it; vision-inducing Dreamwine can be purchased from some of the venues of the Street of a Hundred Taverns.


Altdorf: Crown of the Empire is an excellent and entertaining addition to any gaming table. Packed with esoteric lore, suspicious NPCs, distinctive locations, and intriguing adventure hooks, it is the perfect guide with which to add additional depth and detail to your games of Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay!

boardgame.name: Going Under
boardgame.description: Press Kit description - Going Under is a satirical dungeon crawler about exploring the cursed ruins of failed tech startups. As an unpaid intern in the dystopian city of Neo-Cascadia, you’ll wield office junk as weaponry as you make your way through the offbeat procedural dungeons beneath your company campus.

boardgame.name: MINIT FUN RACER
boardgame.description: Steam description - Buckle up: Minit Fun Racer is a peculiar little racing game with 100% of developer and Devolver's proceeds going directly to charity. Forever.

boardgame.name: Ascii Delve
boardgame.description:
Inspired by Caves of Qud, Rogue, MindExplorer and Dark Fort.

A solo analog game about travelling and exploring dungeons using ascii symbols. Take on the role of the Delver, fight 26 monsters, find the Nine Orbs. Will you help your village?

Uses custom Ascii Dice, a handful of d4s (four sided dice), some pencils and a sheet of paper.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Perplexing Triangle
boardgame.description: A 3 player, 9-card game. At the beginning of the game, each player will draw 3 random cards from a deck of 9, and look at them. Each card is given a number of cubes that are placed on said card, these cubes serve as health, for example, kings have 6 health cubes, Queens have 5, Jacks have 4, and all other cards have 3. Each round, players have to place 1 or 2 cards of their choosing in their “card placing section”. Each time a player does this, they lose a piece of “health” on each of their placed cards (marked by moving the cube to resemble that its value has decreased by 1, ex: moving 6 to 5). After every turn, each player has to give one of their cards to the player in the clockwise direction. Once a card’s health reaches 0, the card is flipped over to show that it can’t be used anymore, it is then placed in the middle along with its health cube. Once a player’s entire deck is obsolete/can’t be used anymore, they’re out, and the last card standing wins.

boardgame.name: Skeletal Drug Test Administrator
boardgame.description:
From the description:

There are libraries of knowledge to be discovered and lingered over in a simple cup full of urine. Skin only gets in the way.

Too many game systems have their limitations immediately revealed when a player asks "Is there any way I can play a magically reanimated skeleton whose primary function is to administrate drug tests and perform urinalysis? "

Too many players have left gaming groups disappointed at the lack of support for adventures that feature a "urine spectroanalysis mechano-tongue."

No longer.

We proudly present the Skeletal Drug Test Administrator, a playable background for TROIKA!.

boardgame.name: Odisseia Backgrounds
boardgame.description:
From the description:

In this document, you will find 12 backgrounds for all your spacefaring, interspherical Troika! adventures.

boardgame.name: Fyra
boardgame.description:
Fyra is a card game about matching and stacking meant for 1-4 players who have, at a minimum, the ability to differentiate colors or printed patterns. You take turns matching up your cards with the ones already on the play field. The cards overlap but you must match the colors of at least one of the corners. If you can't find a spot for your cards, you get to place one next to the other cards, but have to take two replacements. Alternately, if you find a spot where you can match all four corners you don't have to take any replacement cards and get one step closer to going out.

The real fun comes in when you choose a team color and try to make sure as few of those squares are showing by the time you go out. Make alliances to spread one player's color all over the field and make their score worse while setting up spots where you can match up all your own corners the next time your turn comes around. There are 2 goals: be the first to get rid of all your cards and second, have the fewest squares of your color on the play field when you do.

You can also play a solo game trying to make the smallest pile of cards based on randomly selected hands of cards. A game with 4 players should last around 5 to 20 minutes.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Hide 'N Cheek
boardgame.description:
Put on your chipmunk mask and transform into a cheerful woodland creature in Hide 'n Cheek! Players Hunt for acorns in this log-switching, nut-finding, cheek-stuffing game. Hide the Nuts, shuffle the logs, gather the acorns, and watch your chipmunk cheeks grow. Hid 'n Cheek brings home the feel of the forest in this nutty game of hunting and hoarding fun!

To play, hide 3 acorns under one or more of the 4 cups (depicted as logs) and then shuffle all the logs. The player on the left begins first and chooses one log to look under. Keep any acorns one might find and stuff them into your Chipmunk Mask cheek. Play continues with each successive player looking under the logs until all 3 acorns are found. A new round is then started with 3 more acorns.

Game ends when all 40 acorns are distributed. The player who collected the most acorns into their cheek is the Hide 'n Cheek champion!

boardgame.name: Of Breath and Flow
boardgame.description:
A Savage Wuxia action supplement

Publisher's blurb:

Add some cultivation to your Savage Worlds Adventure Edition game, Cutivated Chi, that is! Of Breath and Flow is a collection of rules and setting content that GMs can use to add a Wuxia action vibe to any game they run, from fantasy to Sci-Fi.

Inside are 12 new Edges (and 2 thematically appropriate Hindrances), 5 Fu Schools, 20 Fu Styles, 3 new Powers, and an appendix of more than 20 traditional Fu weapons, plus rules on the Wu Xing 5-element cycle as Trapping, and Cutivated Chi.

boardgame.name: YADOKARICK
ã¤ãã«ãªãã¯
boardgame.description:
YADOKARICK is a trick-taking game in which 1-7 players try to find the right size shell for their hermit crab from beach detritus.

The game consists of two suits, and in addition to a suit and rank, each card has a "shell size". During the game, the lowest card played to a trick will be able to adjust the target shell size up or down. The highest card of each color played to a trick will take the cards of that color with the largest size and add to their hermit crab. The bodies have a maximum size and may have a "roof" card added.

At the end of a hand, positive points are earned for total shell sizes less than or equal to the target, and points are lost for shells that exceed the size or for players who added too many cards to their shell. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: The Binding of Isaac: Repentance
boardgame.description:
Steam body description - PRAY FOR REPENTANCE AND BE REBORN
Experience the modern classic, The Binding of Isaac, like you've never seen it before. It's a game too big to be called a sequel: Repentance takes Isaac to new heights of roguelike dungeon adventure, as the brave boy descends into the basement for his greatest challenge yet! Isaac's new quest takes him to unknown places he's never been, filled with horrible new enemies and bosses, weapon combos you've never synergized before and items he's never seen... unholy terrors from his wildest dreams and worst nightmares!
boardgame.videogamebg: The Binding of Isaac: Four Souls Requiem

boardgame.name: Robocalypse: A drinking game for f*cked up futurists
boardgame.description:
Delve into critical and heated discussions about the future of artificial intelligence around the dinner table while having a drink (or five...)

Robocalypse is an AI-inspired, critical thinking, drinking game. It encourages ethical debate (heated discussion) and a critical examination of future technologies and societies. It's perfect for a rowdy dinner party, pre-drinks with rogue friends or intellectual discourse with your sober Sallys.

Robocalypse is simple, first you read a Judgement card aloud to your Council. This Judgement card contains a question which will be thought provoking, a little weird, and divisive. If you can’t all come to a consensus, pick up an Anarchy card which contains a mini drinking game, and let the beverage consuming commence. At the end of your round, the person in your council with the most f*cked up argument is given the Judgement card. Whoever is rewarded the most Judgement cards at the end of the game wins! Find out who shares your morals and who’s a little f*cked in the head. Maybe you’ll learn a little too...

We want to curate an experience for people to feel comfortable talking about AI, regardless of their technical ability or knowledge. We want to help discern the ethical complexities of machine learning to expose the myths and empower our players to critically evaluate and engage in its social implications in the most fun way possible! This game can also be played without the drinking element by removing the Anarchy cards.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mythic Magazine (Volume 4 - Mar 2021)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Content:

What If: Getting Prepared For A Solo Adventure
Tool Box: Mythic & Crafter Flowcharts
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Getting Prepared For A Solo Adventure

boardgame.name: Precious Little Animal
boardgame.description:
Designer blurb:

Precious Little Animal is a one-player game about noticing the good things in your life, and sharing them with an imaginary animal friend.

Play for 15-30 minutes, at the end of each day, for seven days.

In Precious Little Animal, you’ll take a few minutes at the end of the day to reflect on what happened that day: what you did, what you’ll remember, and what you enjoyed. At the same time, you’ll be writing a story about a cute little animal. You’ll take a few things that happened to you each day, and have them happen to your animal, too.

Make a little animal friend.

On the first day, you’ll write about (or draw!) a little animal. On each day you’re playing, you’ll write down three good things that happened that day. Then you’ll figure out how those things happened to your animal. Maybe your call with a friend was a visit from a friendly Raccoon. Maybe your hour of uninterrupted work time was their quiet hour in the vegetable garden. Maybe your moment of noticing just how blue and clear the sky can be happened just the same way to them.

Your journal of your own life will also be a record of theirs.

In my experience, this practice of writing three good things has become more difficult during times of intense suffering and uncertainty – but also more vital and more satisfying. I hope that through this simple week of journaling, players will share my experience of being more attuned to moments of contentment, and find simple joys glittering and urgent like shards of glass in the dirt.

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror (Third Edition): Deluxe Rulebook
boardgame.description:
With the Arkham Horror Third Edition Deluxe Rulebook, you’ll receive both the Learn to Play and the Rules Reference from the retail version of the game bound together into a premium hardback book. Not only will this book act as your guide as you attempt to unravel arcane mysteries and conspiracies, it also vividly explores the lore surrounding your investigations in Arkham.

The book delves into the rich history of each of Arkham’s neighborhoods, providing a rich backdrop to every game. It also introduces you to two of the game's newest investigators with two full-length short stories that invite you to confront the madness of Arkham through their eyes! Finally, the Deluxe Rulebook also contains a four-page foreword written by the original Arkham Horror designer, Richard Launius, offering even greater insight into the evolution of Arkham Horror and the Arkham Horror Files series of games.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Battles: Ultra Simple Games
boardgame.description:
Simple set of fantasy miniature wargaming rules available for free.

Turn Sequence:
Initiative Phase
Command Phase
Action Phase
Army Morale Phase

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 7 Moons: Heroes of Dragon Reach
boardgame.description:
7 Moons is an original board game from Gunpowder Studios, set in a mythical, magical world of dragons and monsters, where 1-4 players seek to save the beautiful kingdom of Dragon Reach from the impending Shadow Army.

An easy to learn, 1-4 player board game of strategy, acquisition and adventure in a mythical, magical land.
In 7 Moons you play a royal emissary, sent out by your monarch into the kingdom to organise the defence of your city against the approaching Shadow Army. You will travel the lands, buying and selling resources to fill your war chest, building defences, recruiting allies and completing quests. You have little time and much to do, so choose your strategy wisely. Those best prepared have the greatest chance of surviving the monstrous onslaught. The rest will not live to see another moon.

—description from the publisher
